alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 05 at 3:58AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: .Water levels on the Mendenhall are rising at an accelerated rate. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...The Mendenhall Lake and River around the glacier visitor center, the Mendenhall campground, Skaters Cabin Road, View Drive and possibly below Back Loop bridge. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 345 AM AKDT, water levels are rising at an accelerated rate a quarter foot per hour. This rate is exceeding the current forecast and therefore will reach the moderate flood stage of 10 feet in the next couple hours rather than late Saturday afternoon. - For Mendenhall Lake : At 3:15am the stage was 9.22 feet. Minor Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Moderate Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of around 10.7 feet is expected Saturday. Impacts: At 9.0 feet: Water covers Skaters Cabin Road between Skaters Cabin and West Glacier Trailhead, also water will flow into the Mendenhall Lake Campground. At 10.0 feet: Water levels will inundate Mendenhall Campground with up to 3 feet of water covering low areas as well as up to 1.5 feet of water covering Skaters Cabin Road. Portions of West Glacier Trail will be impassable. At 10.4 feet: Significant flooding along the Mendenhall Lake area with more than 3 feet of water in places and the Mendenhall campground will be evacuated. Some homes along View Drive will have up to 3 ft of water in yards. At 10.9 feet: View Drive will be flooded and impassable with significant flooding to some homes in the area. Locations below back loop bridge will begin to see flooding of some yards, significant bank erosion along with hazardous navigation from debris in the river. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - If you live near or along the Mendenhall River, stay alert and be prepared to take action. - Mariners should be aware of additional debris in the water.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
